item.title: “Road Trip” (Remastered) - WAVZ [Feedback!]
item.dc:creator: WAVZ
item.description:
Appreciate it man! Every chord is supposed to be a little off key just to add an effect- I don’t really know what it is exactly- it blends it in with some of the additional sounds imo… I’m going to release a bunch of songs like that in various packs- would you like me to let you know when they are available?

Read full topic

item.title: “Road Trip” (Remastered) - WAVZ [Feedback!]
item.dc:creator: Morgen
item.description:
Hey @WAVZ,

I really like this one, you clearly seem to have a talent/ear for songwriting and creating great sounds (two different skills😊), there’s lots of them in this track. I like the chord progression too, just overall a song I would like to listen to more.

As far as points if possible improvement, the chord at 0:39.5 doesn’t work to my ear. Maybe it’s the instrument, but something is dissonant (unless it’s on purpose).

Read full topic

item.title: “Road Trip” (Remastered) - WAVZ [Feedback!]
item.dc:creator: WAVZ
item.description:
Plus I like to upload original songs, and then keep updating them to show progress whoever the draft to this song is not uploaded anymore, but this updated version is a step up from the original lol

Read full topic

item.title: “Road Trip” (Remastered) - WAVZ [Feedback!]
item.dc:creator: WAVZ
item.description:
I understand what you’re saying- I used to work in small studio as an engineer recording LIVE instruments, on an older interface, so I am aware what mastering is- I personally just use the term lightly displaying a tune up in sound, or with more balances in the volumes and automations- I’m new to this program so I’m aware some of my instruments may be off balanced here and there- but more of the songs I upload are just to grab attention of artists, and then I’ll really sit down, and export it to a real DAW like Logic Pro

Read full topic

item.title: “Road Trip” (Remastered) - WAVZ [Feedback!]
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Hey, WAVZ, it’s Nick Elle.

Very nice track! Very chill, and the vibes are super sweet!

Quick question, though.
Why do you consider this a “remaster?”

Mastering is an audio engineering term, which is a process that you run your final audio source through. The basics have to do with EQ, compression, and limiting, plus a whole bunch more, if needed.
A remaster is basically a redo of the mastering process.

I wouldn’t say your tracks are mastered, so would this song be a “VIP” (Variation In Production)?

for example: WAVZ - Road Trip (VIP)

Read full topic
